message:
Hello Guys. look, 
early this year i asked you if i should put my time on js/ruby instead of php. 
& by your help i have chosen js & it was the best thing i did all year. i can do things now that i didn't even know it can be done. 
js really made my life easier. 
every complicated task i have ever had wes suddenly easier & faster to implement: ( nodejs / gulp / yeoman / webpack / react / angular / ionic / electron )

but i need you again now. over the last year i have noticed that the (go) community is growing larger & larger. 
should i focus on getting better with nodejs & the rest of js world. 
or i should put my free time on learning (go).

will learning go & mastering it provide me with better jobs than i can get with node //& is go needed in the freelancing community yet or it's just for big company ???

data.message:
Mohamed Meligy
Emad Elsaid
Ahmad Alfy
Alaa Attya Mohamed
Ayman Elarian
I don't know a lot about Go tbh. However, I like Meteor.js and working on mastering it completely. It worth giving it a look ðŸ˜ŠðŸ˜Š

If you're looking for getting things done in less time (and comfortable with the convention over configuration) go for Ruby in rails. For me i did not built a complete project in go so honestly i can't help with it or know the best cases to use go :D
If you're talking about finding job, all types of developers are required now. The number of talented developers is decreasing. But for sure the highest salaries goes for Rails.

Do not be a magpie developer (magpies are birds that collect shiny things). You need deepness and experience in a chosen single language.
https://blog.codinghorror.com/the-magpie-developer/

If you have a lot of time in your hand, go learn go, a different style programming language is a different thinking style, so, you expand your mind.

I wouldn't call it a priority though. A minor improvement over just doing Node. I wouldn't focus for several months on Go as a primary thing.
when u get there they would have already left, hit that http://webassembly.org/
Go is your way to go
